docs.abstract: Mr. Collins walked back his statement made Wednesday amid a fiery debate over Congress’s role in matters of war and peace.
docs.snippet: Mr. Collins walked back his statement made Wednesday amid a fiery debate over Congress’s role in matters of war and peace.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Representative Doug Collins of Georgia apologized on Friday for accusing Democrats of being “in love with terrorists,” a claim he hurled during a bitterly partisan dispute over whether to curtail President Trump’s war-making power in Iran.

headline.main: Doug Collins Apologizes for Claiming Democrats Are ‘In Love With Terrorists’
headline.print_headline: Trump Ally Walks Back Attack of Left

docs.abstract: By opting not to change the company’s political advertising rules, Mark Zuckerberg has ensured another election shaped by the social network.
docs.snippet: By opting not to change the company’s political advertising rules, Mark Zuckerberg has ensured another election shaped by the social network.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — If you were hoping to hear less about Facebook this year, you’re out of luck.

headline.main: Buckle Up for Another Facebook Election

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

docs.abstract: Samira Ahmed sued the British public broadcaster for back pay after she learned that a male colleague doing similar work was paid more than six times as much.
docs.snippet: Samira Ahmed sued the British public broadcaster for back pay after she learned that a male colleague doing similar work was paid more than six times as much.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The television host who took the BBC to court over unequal pay has won the first high-profile court case to be brought since the fallout over pay disparity at the public broadcaster began more than two years ago.

headline.main: BBC Underpaid Female TV Host, Tribunal Rules
headline.print_headline: BBC Underpaid Female TV Host, Tribunal Rules in Equal Pay Case

docs.abstract: The lines and poles rebuilt after Hurricane Maria held up, but some power plants did not, leading to another worrying blackout.
docs.snippet: The lines and poles rebuilt after Hurricane Maria held up, but some power plants did not, leading to another worrying blackout.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN JUAN, P.R. — After the devastation of Hurricane Maria, the federal government set aside nearly $2 billion to fix the electrical transmission lines in Puerto Rico, hoping to avert another epic blackout. But when the next disaster arrived this week — the strongest earthquake in a century — the island was once again plunged into darkness.

headline.main: With Earthquakes and Storms, Puerto Rico’s Power Grid Can’t Catch a Break
headline.print_headline: It’s Up, but Puerto Rico’s Grid Is Crippled, Broke and Vulnerable

byline.original: By Patricia Mazzei, Ivan Penn and Frances Robles

docs.abstract: The idea of eternal damnation is neither biblically, philosophically nor morally justified. But for many it retains a psychological allure.
docs.snippet: The idea of eternal damnation is neither biblically, philosophically nor morally justified. But for many it retains a psychological allure.
docs.lead_paragraph: Once the faith of his youth had faded into the serene agnosticism of his mature years, Charles Darwin found himself amazed that anyone could even wish Christianity to be true. Not, that is, the kindlier bits — “Love thy neighbor” and whatnot — but rather the notion that unbelievers (including relatives and friends) might be tormented in hell forever.

headline.main: Why Do People Believe in Hell?
headline.print_headline: Why Do People Believe In Hell?

docs.abstract: Researchers at Penn Medicine in Philadelphia said the procedure could pave a new path to parenthood for women with uterine factor infertility.
docs.snippet: Researchers at Penn Medicine in Philadelphia said the procedure could pave a new path to parenthood for women with uterine factor infertility.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Jennifer Gobrecht was 17, doctors told her that she would never carry her own child.

headline.main: Second U.S. Baby to Be Born From a Dead Donor’s Uterus Is Delivered

docs.abstract: Ivanka Trump’s husband will now supervise her father’s re-election campaign, but he continues to weigh in with advice to the president on a range of other matters.
docs.snippet: Ivanka Trump’s husband will now supervise her father’s re-election campaign, but he continues to weigh in with advice to the president on a range of other matters.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When senior administration officials gathered in the Situation Room on Tuesday for a meeting to discuss the repercussions of the killing of Maj. Gen. Qassim Suleimani, Vice President Mike Pence had a seat at the table. So did Robert O’Brien, the national security adviser, and Mark T. Esper, the defense secretary.

headline.main: Kushner’s Global Role Shrinks as He Tackles Another: The 2020 Election
headline.print_headline: Kushner Changes Focus  To Overseeing Campaign

byline.original: By Annie Karni and Maggie Haberman

docs.abstract: Judge Igor Tuleya has faced threats, fake anthrax attacks and denunciations in the right-wing news media as he fights the government’s campaign to control the courts.
docs.snippet: Judge Igor Tuleya has faced threats, fake anthrax attacks and denunciations in the right-wing news media as he fights the government’s campaign to control the courts.
docs.lead_paragraph: WARSAW — Judge Igor Tuleya has been labeled an enemy of the state by the Polish government, threatened with violence, forced to evacuate his courtroom for fear of anthrax attacks and demonized in the right-wing media as a communist stooge. After someone smeared excrement on the door of his Warsaw apartment, his landlord deemed him too much trouble and evicted him.

headline.main: In Poland, a Stubborn Defender of Judicial Independence
headline.print_headline: In Poland, a Defender  Of Judicial Independence

docs.abstract: Jeremy O. Harris will combine disciplines in a summer festival.
docs.snippet: Jeremy O. Harris will combine disciplines in a summer festival.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jeremy O. Harris, who wrote the acclaimed and provocative “Slave Play,” will be a curator of the High Line’s 2020 “Out of Line” series next summer, which features experimental and multidisciplinary artistic performances inspired by the High Line.

headline.main: Broadway Playwright as High Line Curator
headline.print_headline: Broadway Playwright As High Line Curator

docs.abstract: “Prozac Nation” seemed to herald a boundless future for young creatives. It was actually the beginning of the end.
docs.snippet: “Prozac Nation” seemed to herald a boundless future for young creatives. It was actually the beginning of the end.
docs.lead_paragraph: A few years ago I got an email from Elizabeth Wurtzel telling me that her cancer had returned, and that it was advanced. Saying I was sorry would render precisely the wrong response, she let me know. Her illness didn’t scare her.

headline.main: Elizabeth Wurtzel and the Illusion of Gen-X Success
headline.print_headline: Elizabeth Wurtzel and a Vanishing Dream
